title: 2025 ESC/EACTS Guidelines for the Management of Valvular Heart Disease

aortic_stenosis.title: Section 8: Aortic Stenosis
aortic_stenosis.content:
2025 ESC/EACTS Guidelines for the Management of Valvular Heart Disease - Aortic Stenosis Section

Severity Assessment Criteria:

MILD Aortic Stenosis:
- Aortic Valve Area (AVA): >1.5 cm²
- Indexed AVA (AVAi): >0.85 cm²/m²  
- Mean Gradient: <25 mmHg
- Peak Velocity (Vmax): <3.0 m/s

MODERATE Aortic Stenosis:
- Aortic Valve Area (AVA): 1.0-1.5 cm²
- Indexed AVA (AVAi): 0.60-0.85 cm²/m²
- Mean Gradient: 25-40 mmHg  
- Peak Velocity (Vmax): 3.0-4.0 m/s

SEVERE Aortic Stenosis:
- Aortic Valve Area (AVA): <1.0 cm²
- Indexed AVA (AVAi): <0.60 cm²/m²
- Mean Gradient: >40 mmHg
- Peak Velocity (Vmax): >4.0 m/s

VERY SEVERE Aortic Stenosis:
- Mean Gradient: ≥60 mmHg
- Peak Velocity (Vmax): >5.0 m/s

Special Situations:
- Low-Flow Low-Gradient AS: Mean gradient <40 mmHg with AVA <1.0 cm²
  * With reduced LVEF: Consider dobutamine stress echo
  * With normal LVEF: Stroke Volume Index (SVi) ≤35 mL/m²

Intervention Indications:
- Symptomatic severe AS: intervention recommended for all eligible patients
- Asymptomatic severe AS with LVEF <55% or very severe hemodynamics
- Heart Team decision required for TAVI vs SAVR selection
- Age and anatomical factors guide treatment choice
